title: New Caledonia: The three years that built up to the current crisis
summary: Although the reform of the electoral body provoked the anger of the pro-independence faction before spilling over into violent riots, it was only the detonator of a long crisis marked by a dialogue in disarray, a questioned impartiality of the state, and the will to move forward despite a dwindling consensus.

title: Helicopter carrying Iranian President Raisi still unreachable after 'hard landing'
summary: Rescue efforts to reach the helicopter, with which the authorities have lost contact, are hampered by overcast conditions and nightfall.

title: Taiwan: Under President Tsai Ing-wen, eight years of stability in the storm
summary: During Tsai Ing-wen's two terms as president since 2016, Taiwan has asserted its identity and acquired major geopolitical and economic importance on the international stage. Tsai hands over the reins on Monday to her vice president, Lai Ching-te.

title: 'It burned, it burned!' In the Kharkiv region, thousands of Ukrainians evacuate villages bordering Russia
summary: With the recent advance of Russian forces in the northeast of the country, at least 10,000 people have fled the bombings and the fear of another occupation.

title: The future of electric vehicles is coming up against new economic and political risks
summary: Sluggish sales growth, a possible anti-battery-powered vehicle populist wave in the European elections... Automotive electrification is entering a period of uncertainty, posing major industrial problems for automakers.

title: Timothée Chalamet spotted as Bob Dylan. Does anyone care?
summary: The French-American actor plays the folk legend in 'A Complete Unknown,' a biopic directed by James Mangold currently shooting in New York.

title: Chinese officials are operating in France against dissidents
summary: In two recent cases, one of attempted forcible repatriation, the other of intimidation, French counter-espionage has revealed the presence of members of the Chinese security services in France.

title: New Caledonia: France says it will restore order 'whatever the cost'
summary: French forces cleared dozens of barricades between the airport and the capital Nouméa in an operation on Sunday, as the country's top official in the Pacific territory vowed to quell riots.

title: Slovak PM Fico's life no longer in danger after shooting, says deputy
summary: Prime Minister Robert Fico's 'has emerged from the immediate threat to his life,' but remains in serious condition.

title: Shooting in Kinshasa is a failed coup d'état, says Congolese army
summary: Gunfire erupted in the DRC capital early Sunday morning, as armed men in military uniform clashed with guards at the home of politician Vital Kamerhe.

title: Ukraine's post-25 enlistment policy aims to 'protect the country's future'
summary: Due to declining demographics, the country has chosen not to draft 18-25-year-olds into the armed forces. The average age of those serving in the military is over 40.

title: Mbappé left out of PSG squad for final Ligue 1 match
summary: Kylian Mbappé is not traveling to Metz for the final league match of the season. His last chance to appear for Paris Saint-Germain before his departure will be the Coupe de France final.

title: Paris's Musée de l'Armée traces the history of the duel
summary: An exhibition on show until August documents the codified combat between two individuals, from Antiquity to the present day, in a form of ritualized violence.

title: At least 20 killed in Israeli air strike on Nuseirat refugee camp, says hospital
summary: The strike on Sunday morning was targeting a house belonging to the Hassan family in Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza, the Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital said in a statement.

title: China is no longer Germany's leading trading partner
summary: The US overtook China in trading with Germany in the first quarter – a symbolic change, which could continue.

title: Manchester City wins fourth consecutive Premier League title
summary: Manchester City beat West Ham 3-1 to clinch the title on the final day, ahead of Arsenal.

title: Flash floods kill at least 66 in northern Afghanistan
summary: At least 66 people were killed and others were still missing after heavy flooding. Videos shared on social media platform X this weekend showed torrents of brown water crashing through walls of homes and churning through streets.

title: A Swiss summit for an unlikely peace in Ukraine
summary: Swiss diplomats are trying to convince as many countries as possible to take part in a 'peace conference' on June 15 and 16. Although the meeting is unlikely to result in any concrete progress, it will be an opportunity for Bern to improve its image.

title: At the Opéra Bastille, the madness of a dreamy 'Don Quixote' in love
summary: Absent from France's premier stage since 2002, Jules Massenet's opera is reborn, served by an accomplished vocal cast and Damiano Michieletto's poetic staging.

title: Lai Ching-te inaugurated as Taiwan's president as China pressure grows
summary: The Taiwanese leader was sworn in on Monday as president of the democratic island. Beijing simultaneously announced sanctions against Boeing and two other US defense companies for arms sales to Taiwan.

title: Dominican Republic President Luis Abinader heads to reelection as competitors concede early
summary: The early results showed him with nearly 60% of the votes. His competitors, former President Leonel Fernández and Mayor Abel Martínez, conceded early in the night.

title: Iran President Ebrahim Raisi, who was tipped to succeed supreme leader, has died
summary: The death in a helicopter crash of the ultraconservative leader, aged 65, comes at a time of great tension in the region. A new election is due to be held within the next 50 days.

title: New Caledonia: Pro-independence protesters defy government efforts to unblock roads
summary: French officials said they had cleared 76 barricades between the airport and Nouméa, the capital of the French territory in the Pacific Ocean.

title: Paris train drivers to go on strike Tuesday over Olympic Games bonuses
summary: Rail workers' unions are pressuring SNCF in negotiations over bonuses for working through the Olympic period.

title: In an underground quarry in Normandy, archeologists trace the people who hid from D-Day bombings
summary: During the Allied bombings from June 6 to late July 1944, hundreds of Caen residents took refuge in the Saingt quarry. Now abandoned and largely intact, it is a playground for archeologists, who have turned it into a conservation space and a laboratory for their methods.

title: 'Bodkin' on Netflix: Exquisite corpses litter the Irish coast
summary: Macabre, but not overly so, Jez Scharf's series unleashes three podcasters into a small Irish village whose appearance is as picturesque as its secrets are dark.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Netanyahu caught between war cabinet allies and far-right partners
summary: Retired general Benny Gantz threatened to leave the war cabinet if the prime minister does not chart a clear post-war course in Gaza.

title: 100 days before Paralympics, Paris seeks to boost ticket sales
summary: Organizers have launched an advertising campaign for the Paralympic Games that begin on August 28. Two-thirds of the tickets are still available.

title: Spain's Vox party hosts global far right ahead of EU elections
summary: Marine Le Pen, Viktor Orban, Giorgia Meloni, Javier Milei and even pro-Trump Americans took up the Spanish nationalist party's invitation to prepare 'a global alliance between patriots' at the Viva 24 conference in Madrid on Sunday.

title: Jean-Claude Gaudin, longtime mayor of Marseille, has died
summary: The politician, who died on May 20 at the age of 84, was elected to lead the city of Marseille without interruption from 1995 to 2020.

title: Mayor of New Caledonia's capital: 'We need a pause in the institutional reform and unfreezing of the electorate'
summary: Sonia Lagarde, a supporter of Emmanuel Macron since 2017, urges the French president to take time to reform of the electoral body, which sparked riots in the territory in the Pacific territory. In an interview, she calls for 'appeasement.'

title: South Africa's top court rules former president Zuma cannot stand in election
summary: Jacob Zuma was disqualified from next week's election because he was sentenced to 15 months in prison in 2021.

title: ICC prosecutor seeks arrest warrants for Netanyahu and Hamas leaders
summary: The chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court said he believes Benjamin Netanyahu, his defense minister Yoav Gallant, and three Hamas leaders – Yehia Sinwar, Mohammed Deif and Ismail Haniyeh – are responsible for war crimes and crimes against humanity in the Gaza Strip and Israel.

title: Julian Assange can appeal against extradition to US, London court rules
summary: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange won a bid to appeal against a UK court ruling approving his extradition to the United States to face trial on espionage charges.

title: UK inquiry slams successive governments over blood scandal that killed thousands
summary: Tens of thousands of people were exposed to HIV-tainted blood after being given a new treatment in the 1970s to early 1990s. The chair of the inquiry said 'successive governments... did not put patient safety first.'

title: Iran's nuclear negotiator Ali Bagheri named acting foreign minister
summary: Nuclear negotiator Ali Bagheri has been named acting foreign minister of Iran after his predecessor was killed in a helicopter crash along with the president.

title: Monaco player taping over LGBT logo 'unacceptable,' says French sports minister
summary: The French sports minister has called for sanctions against Mohamed Camara and his Monaco club after he covered a pro-LGBTQ logo on his jersey with white tape.

title: Who is Iran's first vice president, Mohammad Mokhber, appointed acting president after crash?
summary: Mokhber, 68, largely has been in the shadows compared to other politicians in Iran's Shiite theocracy. He is expected to serve as caretaker president for some 50 days before mandatory presidential elections.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: 1 million football tickets still available
summary: Tickets for the men's and women's Olympic football tournaments are struggling to sell. Of the 2.5 million tickets, 1 million have yet to be snapped up.
